intro: Lagochilus seravschanicus, commonly known as the Karakorum bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of blue or violet flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and attractive blooms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
